item.title: Punakha: Where the Rivers Whisper and Time Stands Still
item.description:
The Descent into Silence

If Thimphu is the pulse of Bhutan, Punakha is its soul. The drive from the capital felt like a descent into a deeper, more ancient peace. For me, this was the highlight of the tripâ€”the most silent, serene city I have ever encountered. Punakha doesn’t demand your attention; it simply exists in a state of grace, wrapped in the arms of the mountains and the constant, rhythmic song of its rivers.

item.title: My Bhutan Journey: 8 Days in the Land of Thunder Dragon
item.description:
The Journey That Changed My Perspective

What started as a simple plan to visit Bhutan turned into one of the most transformative travel experiences I’ve ever had. Over 10 days, I journeyed from Gurgaon to Siliguri, then crossed into the serene monasteries of Paro, discovering a country that truly lives by different values.
